Cait Harrigan, MSc.


cait.harriganmail.utoronto.ca ‚ÄÉ|‚ÄÉ View this CV online at caitharrigan.ca/cv


I am a graduate student at the University of Toronto supervised by Quaid Morris and Kieran Campbell, and a graduate affiliate at the Vector Institute. I did my undergraduate studies at the University of Toronto, in Computational Biology and Statistics. My thesis work pertains to cancer genomics, and modelling the evolutionary constraints that underlie how mutation events occur in DNA. I‚Äôm passionate about open science, and promoting great mentorship in the sciences.

Mentoring


when


what


Aug 2020 ‚Äî Aug 2021


MentorHer Code CampHer Code Camp is a free computer science camp for senior high school students in the greater toronto area who identify as a woman, non-binary, or transgender. Over 3 weeks, mentors guide the development of a project in python, and cultivate curiosity in computer science.


Sep 2020 ‚Äî Nov 2020


MentorProjectX UofTProjectX is a two month long machine learning research competition. As a mentor, I worked with a group of 4 students to refine their research proposal, offer advice and guidance on their project design and execution. The team I worked with was awarded X medal in the final evaluation.


Oct 2018 ‚Äî May 2019


MentorMentorship Program, Department of Statistics, University of TorontoCommunicated online and in person with a group of 12 mentees, who were first year undergraduate students in the Statistics Department. Focus on community building and guiding transition into university life, in particular for new international students.


Sep 2016 ‚Äî May 2019


MentorSPROUT Peer Mentorship Program, New College, University of TorontoMet bi-weekly one-on-one with first year undergraduate mentees. Focus on guiding the transition to university life, and promoting healthy life and study habits.


Personal skills & volunteering


when


what


Oct 2020 ‚Äî May 2021


Project ManagerSTEMHub FoundationSTEMHub is a charity that aims to increase accessibility to STEM programs for underserved or low-income communities within Ontario. As a project manager, I designed hands-on science workshops for ages 10-14. Over video-conferencing, I facilitated workshops for 20 students that focused on remote sensing with a rasperry pi, and the biology of seed germination.


Mar 2020


Volunteer CoordinatorGrad Visit Day, Department of Computer Science, University of TorontoOrganized student volunteers, and moderated a student panel aimed at answering questions for prospective Computer Science graduate students.


May 2018 ‚Äî May 2019


TreasurerBioinformatics and Computational Biology Student Union (BCBSU), University of TorontoAs the Treasurer for the BCBSU, I was responsible for managing the group‚Äôs annual budget, and events budgeting. Additionally, as this was the first year of the BCBSU‚Äôs existence, I was heavily involved in the process of achieving University-level campus group recognition, and managing bank accounts, general administration, and writing the group‚Äôs constitution.


Jan 2018


VolunteerUofT Hacks, Major League HackingAided in set-up, take-down of event. Ensured hackathon participants enjoyed event smoothly.


Sep 2016 ‚Äî May 2017


Communications and Marketing ExecutiveUofT Women in Computer Science (WiCS), University of TorontoPrepared event announcements, communicated with department admin to circulate event information, book spaces, organized refreshments for participants.


Sep 2016 ‚Äî May 2017


Middle Year RepresentativeNew College Student Council, University of TorontoAs part of the student council, I budgeted and oversaw several events throughout the year, and actively participated in steering meetings as a representative of the student body in their second and third year of undergrad. I worked closely with the Office of Residence and Student Life to promote student well being and carry out community building initiatives.
